SEARCH
Package model

Class CharList

java.lang.Object
model.CharList
public class CharList extends Object
Represents a doubly linked list of characters that serves as the main index for the phone book structure. This list maintains characters in alphabetical order and provides efficient operations for managing letter groups.

Each character node in this list points to a NameList containing all names that start with that particular letter, creating a hierarchical organization system for the phone book.

Since:
2024

  • Constructor Details

    • CharList

      public CharList()
      Constructs an empty CharList. Initializes head and last references to null and size to zero.

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the list is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the list contains no characters, false otherwise

    • isOnTheList

      public boolean isOnTheList(char letter)
      Checks if a specific letter is present in the list.
      Parameters:
      letter - the character to search for
      Returns:
      true if the letter is found in the list, false otherwise

    • insert

      public void insert(char letter)
      Inserts a new character into the list in alphabetical order. If the letter already exists, no action is taken.
      Parameters:
      letter - the character to be inserted

    • getOrCreateChar

      public NodeChar getOrCreateChar(char letter)
      Retrieves an existing character node or creates a new one if it doesn't exist. This method ensures that a node for the specified letter always exists in the list.
      Parameters:
      letter - the character to retrieve or create
      Returns:
      the NodeChar associated with the specified letter

    • remove

      public void remove(char letter) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Removes a letter from the list and cleans up all associated references.
      Parameters:
      letter - the character to be removed
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the list is empty or the letter is not found

    • clear

      public void clear() throws IllegalArgumentException
      Clears the entire list, removing all characters and resetting the structure.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the list is already empty

    • get

      public NodeChar get(int index) throws IllegalArgumentException, IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the node at the specified index in the list. Uses an optimization strategy by traversing from the head for indices in the first half and from the tail for indices in the second half.
      Parameters:
      index - the position of the node to retrieve (0-based)
      Returns:
      the NodeChar at the specified index
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the list is empty
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of range

    • get

      public NodeChar get(char letter) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Returns the node associated with a specific letter.
      Parameters:
      letter - the character to search for
      Returns:
      the NodeChar associated with the specified letter
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the list is empty or the letter is not found

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of characters in the list.
      Returns:
      the size of the list

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Generates a string representation of the list. The output format is a comma-separated list of characters enclosed in square brackets.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of the list

    • getHead

      public NodeChar getHead()
      Returns the first node in the list.
      Returns:
      the head node of the list, or null if the list is empty

    • getLast

      public NodeChar getLast()
      Returns the last node in the list.
      Returns:
      the last node of the list, or null if the list is empty

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the number of characters in the list. This method provides an alternative to size() for consistency with other getter methods.
      Returns:
      the size of the list
